ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, I worry all the time about whether the pain will end.
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, I feel I can't go on
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, It's terrible and I think it's never going to get any better
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, It's awful and I feel that it overwhelms me.
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, I feel I can't stand it anymore.
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I am in pain, I become afraid that the pain will get worse.
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, I keep thinking of other painful events.
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, I anxiously want the pain to go away.
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, I can't seem to get it out of my mind.
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, I keep thinking about how much it hurts.
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, I keep thinking about how badly I want the pain to stop.
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, There's nothing I can do to reduce the intensity of the pain
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: When I'm in pain, I wonder whether something serious may happen.
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = To a slight degree; 2 = To a moderate degree; 3 = To a great degree; 4 = All the time

ElementDescription: PCS total score
Rumination score
Magnification score
Helplessness score
PCS Percentile
Timepoint/visit label
